title: $$\frac{Equation}{Substitute}$$
text: The equation for calculuating the rate of change is $$\frac{f{\left(x_1\right)}-f{\left(x_2\right)}}{x_1-x_2}$$. So to find the answer, we can start by plugging in $$x+h$$ for $$x_1$$ and $$x$$ for $$x_2$$, and we get the expression ((2(x+h)**2-3(x+h))-(2x**2 -3x))/(x+h - x).

title: Simplify
text: Simplify the numerator, and we get the expression $$4xh+2h^2-3h$$.

title: Divide
text: $$\frac{Divide}{Cross}$$ out the $$h$$ terms in the numerator and denominator, and we get our answer $$4x+2h-3$$.
